title: Understanding Data Integrity
text: Data integrity refers to the accuracy and consistency of data over its lifecycle. It is a critical aspect of the design, implementation, and usage of any system that stores, processes, or retrieves data.

hintAnswer: Performing data validation checks to ensure data is accurate and complete.
title: Identifying Data Validation Steps
text: What is one of the first steps you should take to ensure data validity?
choices: Performing data validation checks to ensure data is accurate and complete
Assuming data is valid if it looks correct

title: Data Validation Techniques
text: Data validation techniques include checking for data type consistency, range checks, and format checks. These techniques help ensure that the data is accurate and reliable.

hintAnswer: Implementing data synchronization processes to keep data consistent across systems.
title: Ensuring Data Consistency
text: How can you ensure that data remains consistent across different systems?
choices: Implementing data synchronization processes to keep data consistent across systems
Assuming data is consistent if it is stored in a central database

title: Data Synchronization
text: Data synchronization involves ensuring that data is consistent and up-to-date across different systems or databases. This can be achieved through regular updates and checks.
